![Eunhaeng Botanical Garden (ÏùÄÌñâÏãùÎ¨ºÏõê (ÏùÄÌñâÏûêÏó∞Í¥ÄÏ∞∞Ïõê))](/2022-08-23-1661247612629/1865972_image2_1.webp) ## Overview > Eunhaeng Botanical Garden is operated by Seongnam-si. The garden was originally a discarded drainage area that was transformed into an ecological park with an arboretum. The garden is rich in greenery, with a diverse range of plants, wildflowers, and insects, making it an ideal place for students to see and learn about nature. The garden is also a beautiful recreation area for local residents.

* Facility area - 34,760„é° (10,533 pyeong) / Visitor center area 202„é° (61 pyeong)
* Plants: 89 species 2,317 plants, Shrub: 78 species 13,689 shrubs, Flowering plants: 209 species 94,329 plants
* Insects - Ladybug, butterfly with four feet, Monema flavescens, Riptortus clavatus, black-tipped leafhopper, Poecilocoris lewisi, etc. ## Intro | | | | - | - | |infocenter:|‚Ä¢ 1330 Travel Hotline: +82-2-1330
(Korean, English, Japanese, Chinese)
‚Ä¢ For more info: +82-31-729-4319| |opendate:|October 30, 2002| |parking:|Available (Near the Visitor's Center or garden)| |restdate:|The day of Seollal (Lunar New Year's Day) and Chuseok (Korean Thanksgiving Day)| |usetime:|June-September 09:00-19:00
October-May 09:00-18:00| ## Detail Info | | | | - | - | |Tour Course Information:|Visitor's center - greenhouse - Miro Plaza - shrubbery garden A - azalea garden - theme circle - wild chrysanthemum garden - silver grass garden - water parsley garden - orange stonecrop garden - complex seasonal garden A - aquatic botanical garden - alpine botanical garden - lily garden - edible botanical garden - herb garden - complex seasonal garden B - shrubbery garden B - outdoor stage - eco pond| |Restrooms:|Available| |Available Facilities:|Visitor's Center, greenhouse, maze square, outdoor performance hall, ecological pond, aquatic botanical garden, herb garden, perfume garden, etc.| ## Detail Image ![/2022-08-23-1661247612629/1865975_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-23-1661247612629/1865975_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-08-23-1661247612629/1865982_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-23-1661247612629/1865982_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-08-23-1661247612629/1865983_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-23-1661247612629/1865983_image2_1.webp) ## Contact - [‚òéÔ∏è+82-31-729-4319](tel:+82317294319) - [üè†epark.seongnam.go.kr](http://epark.seongnam.go.kr/main/index.asp) ```googleMap latitude: 37.4532263470 longitude: 127.1668682019 title: 72, Eunhaeng-ro, Jungwon-gu, Seongnam-si, Gyeonggi-do ``` ## Directions [Bus]
At Namhansanseong Station (Seoul Subway Line 8), Exit 6, take Bus No. 6.
Get off at Eunhaeng-dong Community Center Bus Stop.
Walk for approx. 5 min to the garden.

data.title: Eunhaeng Botanical Garden (ÏùÄÌñâÏãùÎ¨ºÏõê (ÏùÄÌñâÏûêÏó∞Í¥ÄÏ∞∞Ïõê))
data.description:
Eunhaeng Botanical Garden is operated by Seongnam-si. The garden was originally a discarded drainage area that was transformed into an ecological park with an arboretum. The garden is rich in greenery, with a diverse range of plants, wildflowers, and insects, making it an ideal place for students to see and learn about nature. The garden is also a beautiful recreation area for local residents.

* Facility area - 34,760„é° (10,533 pyeong) / Visitor center area 202„é° (61 pyeong)
* Plants 89 species 2,317 plants, Shrub 78 species 13,689 shrubs, Flowering plants 209 species94,329 plants
* Insects - Ladybug, butterfly with four feet, Monema flavescens, Riptortus clavatus, black-tipped leafhopper, Poecilocoris lewisi, etc.
data.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: La Vie D'or Resort & Country Club (ÎùºÎπÑÎèåÎ¶¨Ï°∞Ìä∏)
dataList.description: Located 30 minutes from Seoul, LA VIE D'OR Resort & Country Club is a large (330,578 meters square) leisure complex appropriate for visitors of all ages. In addition to Western and Korean-style guestrooms, the resort offers Korean, Chinese, and Western restaurants, an expertly landscape golf driving range, indoor and outdoor swimming pools, numerous sports facilities, and a sauna. Reminiscent of European architecture, the ivory-colored resort (B1-17F) is designed to harmonize with the region‚Äôs natural beauty. Attractions such as Yungneung, Geolleung, and the Yongju Temple are only 5 minutes away and many other tourist locations are within a 30-minute drive.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Korean Traditional House Association (ÌïúÍµ≠Ï†ÑÌÜµÍ∞ÄÏò•ÌòëÌöå)
dataList.description: Korea Traditional House Association studies traditional houses which embrace the spirit of the ancestors and develop traditional cultural asset by creating miniatures of the houses. Through in-site survey and history of ancestors, the area is reproduced intact down to the structure, materials and architectural method used, creating a lively miniature village.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Korean Folk Village (ÌïúÍµ≠ÎØºÏÜçÏ¥å)
dataList.description:
Korean Folk Village introduces traditional culture from the late Joseon period to both local and international visitors through cultural classes experience, shaman faith, seasonal customs and others. It recreated the past through the restoration of houses from the Joseon dynasty.

Performances including nongak (farmer‚Äôs music), martial arts on horseback, traditional wedding ceremony, and other special events are available by season. In particular, Welcome to Joseon, an event held every May, takes visitors back to the past. In addition, a family-friendly theme park equipped with 15 exciting attractions is also available. Visitors can also try various Korean foods at the market street.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Korea National Arboretum and Forest Museum (Gwangneung Forest) (Íµ≠Î¶ΩÏàòÎ™©Ïõê (Í¥ëÎ¶âÏà≤))
dataList.description:
The Korea National Arboretum (KNA) is situated in Gwangneung Experimental Forest and contains the Forest Museum where all the information on forestry is exhibited. The construction of the arboretum and museum took place on October 25, 1985 and opened on April 5, 1987. In order to preserve the forests, weekends and holiday entrance were restricted, reservations were required 5 days in advance, and no more than 5,000 visitors were accepted per day. As diverse plants are gaining recognition worldwide, the research department formed the Office of Forestry on May 24, 1999.

Korea National Arboretum covers an area of 1,157„èä and contains 15 specialized forests, including Conifer Garden, the Garden of Ornamental Trees, and the Aroma and Touch Garden. The Forest Museum is the largest in Asia, covering 4628 sq.m¬≤ with a traditional Korean design, and the interior and exterior are both constructed of wood and stone. The arboretum facilities consist of 5 exhibition halls (Living Forest, Forest and Man, Forestry of the World, Forestry of Korea, Nature of Korea), a Herbarium, a Special Exhibition Room, and an Audio Visual Hall.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Konjiam Resort (Í≥§ÏßÄÏïîÎ¶¨Ï°∞Ìä∏)
dataList.description:
Located in Nogobong Valley in Taehwasan Mountain in Gwangju-gun, Gyeonggi-do Province, Konjiam Resort is only an hour away by car from the Gangnam area in Seoul. The year-round resort boasts the largest ski slopes of Gyeonggi-do Province, a condominium with 476 rooms, the nation‚Äôs first residential spa, and a variety of other facilities.

Some of the most unique features of the resort are the ecological stream running through the resort and the cave wine cellar where about 90,000 bottles of wine are stored. Another visitor favorite is the Konjiam Arboretum, which has 3,700 species of plants and about 20 themed gardens.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Key Observatory (Ïó¥Ïá†Ï†ÑÎßùÎåÄ)
dataList.description: Called to play the role of an important key for unification, Key Observatory was established on April 11, 1998 to commemorate the sorrow of homesickness and provide security education in the area of Dapgok-ri, Yeoncheon-gun. Military in the area can also keep watch over the north from this location. It is open to members of the public who complete an identification check. After the check, soldiers will open the barricade for admission. From the observatory, visitors can see the green verdure surrounding the north region with one's naked eye but taking photos is prohibited.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Kalbongsan Recreational Forest (ÏπºÎ¥âÏÇ∞ÏûêÏó∞Ìú¥ÏñëÎ¶º)
dataList.description: Kalbongsan Recreational Forest is located between Gyeongbangyegok Valley, famous for Surakpokpo Falls, and Yongchugyegok Valley, famous for Yongchupokpo Falls. The forest is a popular summer vacation spot for families due to the pure natural environment. Kalbongsan Mountain also provides many trekking paths.
dataList.author: korea-tour
